heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Has a clear willingness to learn and apply relevant economic theory and can discuss the limits of theory when it comes to real world application.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Displays sufficient depth and breadth of understanding of core economics.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Has the ability to explain and apply theory from different branches of economics - for example applying behavioural economics to a microeconomic context, applying economic history to macroeconomics / contemporary macroeconomic context etc. Can demonstrate an emergent capability to tailor such theoretical application to their environment (role, departmental context, policy context etc).

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Can explain and apply concepts in intermediate microeconomics and macroeconomics.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Is able to demonstrate elements of specialist economics knowledge in a specific field (such as international trade, industrial economics, development economics, public finance) and/or can demonstrate advanced Departmental or role-specific economic knowledge.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Can explain and apply a variety of economic tools, techniques, and methods to a range of work/policy areas, making use of relevant economic theory (e.g. international trade, industrial economics, development economics, public finance) to develop/oversee the evidence base for policy development. Must demonstrate this ability across the areas of macroeconomics and microeconomics.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Able to scope areas of work identifying objectives, analytical methods, resources required and potential delivery risks.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Able to recognise when complementary expertise and collaborative working is required e.g., scientists, other social scientists, other government analytical professions and data specialists.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Understands high-level business objectives and strategy to anticipate demands for economic analysis.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Oversees and challenges as appropriate the application of economic tools, techniques, and methods to a range of policy areas, making use of deep department-specific economic knowledge.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Scopes broad areas of work identifying objectives, analytical methods, resources required and potential delivery risks.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Can recognise and digest complementary expertise from e.g., scientists, other social scientists, other government analytical professions, and data specialists.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Leads teams to deliver cohesive analytical programmes across professions.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Uses economic insight to interpret high level strategic challenges.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Co-ordinates and directs analytical resources [or workstreams] to meet departmental and ministerial objectives.

heading: Applying economic theory and analysis
content: Addresses the challenges of competing priorities for resourcing of economic analysis.

heading: Synthesising the evidence
content: Displays an ability to assess different methods, data or results being used, and to comment on the appropriateness of these methods.

heading: Synthesising the evidence
content: Analyses complex information and data, drawing on economic knowledge and applying it to questions of interest for the department, while being aware of the limitations of economic analysis and the available data.

heading: Synthesising the evidence
content: Analyses and synthesises complex information and data, drawing on economic knowledge and applying it to questions of interest for the department, while being aware of the limitations/risks of economic analysis and the available data. This may include developing detailed knowledge or expertise of a technical area.

heading: Synthesising the evidence
content: Leads development of analysis and synthesises evidence from a range of data and complex information sources, combining and developing these as appropriate. This will include building an understanding of data sources, measurement techniques and analytical debate relating to specific policy areas and ensuring issues of economic inequality and distribution are considered as required.

heading: Synthesising the evidence
content: Is accountable and ensures consistency between analytical products delivered across teams. This will include building an understanding of the opportunities and limitations of data sources, measurement techniques and analytical debate relating to specific policy areas and ensuring issues of economic inequality and distribution are considered as required.

heading: Synthesising the evidence
content: Creates and supports teams that challenge and improve the evidence base, draw on diverse perspectives across professional boundaries and consider economic inequality and redistribution as required.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Can contribute to an economic project with support.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Works independently on an economic/analytical project.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Escalates analytical issues appropriately.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Is competent in scoping and leading analytical research design.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Can take responsibility for wider analytical projects.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Uses horizon scanning methodologies to anticipate new trends, opportunities and challenges that may influence outcomes of interest to the customers.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Delivery of high quality analysis to the standards set out in the green, aqua and magenta books.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Uses horizon scanning methodologies to anticipate new trends, opportunities and challenges that may influence outcomes of interest to team/departments/stakeholders.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Leads the delivery, or contributes to delivery, of policy appraisal, impact assessments, evidence-based business cases, and evaluation to the standards set out in the Green. Aqua and Magenta Books. This will include engaging with, and bringing in expertise from, other analytical professions as appropriate.

heading: Deliver economic analysis
content: Leads experts to deliver high quality economic analysis, critically appraising methods in line with best practice guidelines. This also includes developing and adding to best practice where possible.

heading: Expanding the evidence base
content: Skill not generally expected at this grade. However, some roles may include identifying evidence gaps.

heading: Expanding the evidence base
content: Undertakes analysis to fill evidence gaps identified.

heading: Expanding the evidence base
content: Takes responsibility for wider analytical projects which address identified evidence gaps.

heading: Expanding the evidence base
content: Expands and develops the evidence base for future policy development. This includes anticipating evidence gaps and future evidence needs, scoping work projects, managing internal and external analytical programmes and building links with academia and wider research communities.

heading: Expanding the evidence base
content: Expands and develops the evidence base for future policy development. This includes anticipating evidence gaps and future evidence needs, scoping work programmes, managing internal and external analytical programmes, proactively building networks with academia and wider research communities. Includes finding new ways of influencing policy and keeping up to date with policy debates in the area of expertise.

heading: Expanding the evidence base
content: Identifies where and how new analysis can provide insight into strategic challenges. Marshalls analytical resources to do so, leveraging external networks where appropriate.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: Is familiar with and learning the basics of techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined in the Green Book, in order to apply Cost-Benefit Analysis.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: Learns and applies techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined in the Green Book, in order to produce Cost-Benefit Analysis.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: Uses techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined in the Green Book, in order to apply Cost-Benefit Analysis.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: Uses and supervises the application of techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined in the Green Book, in order to apply Cost-Benefit Analysis.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: · Where appropriate, demonstrates the ability to develop and improve techniques used and actively participate in quality- assurance procedures and processes.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: · Critically reviews and suggests improvements to techniques to establish/identify robust counterfactuals to effectively measure policy impact and causation as detailed in the Magenta Book.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: Supervises the application of and critically assesses techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined by the Green Book, in order to apply Cost Benefit Analysis. Where needed, this includes balancing conflicting methods and techniques used in the analysis and managing the quality-assurance process.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: · Critically reviews and suggests improvements to techniques used by the team to establish/identify robust counterfactuals to effectively measure policy impact and causation as detailed in the Magenta Book.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: Influences stakeholders at all levels to ensure cutting edge, timely appraisal is carried out and influences decisions.

heading: Applying appraisal techniques
content: · Takes a strategic approach to longer term development of techniques and tools available.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Actively engages in wider learning and development to support formal learning.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Develops oneself as a professional economist by continuing to seek out training and support that enables confident delivery of the above.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Develops oneself as a professional economist by continuing to seek out training, teaching and coaching opportunities as well as promoting economics that enables confident delivery of the above.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Keeps up to date with relevant academic literature, developments in data science, techniques (e.g. behavioural insights) and contributes to wider debates within the organisation and economic profession.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Operates with credibility in an inclusive way, is accountable for the work of the team(s) (where applicable) and champions the economics profession including volunteering as a GES Assessor as per requirements.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Seeks out mentoring opportunities and/or acts as a mentor (formally or informally) to GES Apprentices, HEOs and SEOs.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Seeks out opportunities to embed D&I learning to enable inclusive approaches.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Keeps up to date with the latest relevant academic literature, developments in data science, techniques (e.g., behavioural insights) and contributes to wider debates within the organisation and economic profession.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Operates with credibility in an inclusive way, is accountable for the work of the team(s) (where applicable) and champions the economics profession.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Actively keeps abreast of, and contributes to, relevant economic developments within and outside the Department, including internationally, adopting, and promoting good practice.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Acts as a mentor to GES Apprentices, HEOs SEOs and G7s.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Engages in senior management events and leadership training sessions to build capability and influence others.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Acts as a mentor to G6/G7s.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Can lead and coach policy/economic colleagues and Ministers through analysis and support their understanding.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Oversees the development of economists by ensuring training and support is accessible.

heading: Development as an economist
content: Provide highest level QA in line with departmental processes.
